p: Tourism and travel (e.g., trains, airplanes, and cruise ships) are associated with the highest risk of infection because they take place in generally highly concentrated areas with people who have visited multiple countries. Abstaining from visiting airports and cruise ships is recommended by the CDC (2020g). In addition, the CDC recommends maintaining household emergency plans. Families should consider alternative options for work and school in case local and federal governments call for a shutdown. A two-headed approach of prevention and containment offers the greatest intervention point with COVID-19. Individuals who believe they have contracted COVID-19 but are clinically stable should remain at home and self-quarantine for 14â€¯days minimum and make a telephone visit to determine if further medical care is required ( CDC, 2020h) . This reduces the risk of infecting the individuals at hospitals with chronic illness who are the most susceptible to severe respiratory failure and alleviates the burden of overwhelming hospital personnel.
